title: Sync Engine Concepts
description: Test your understanding of sync engine design.

questions.question: In a local-first architecture, when should you write to the local database?
options: After the server confirms the write
Immediately when the user takes action
questions.explanation: In local-first, you write to the local database immediately when the user takes action. This provides instant feedback and works offline. Sync to server happens in the background.

questions.question: What should happen when a sync operation fails due to a network error?
options: Delete the operation from the queue
Show an error to the user immediately
Keep in queue and retry with exponential backoff
questions.explanation: Network errors are transient. The operation should stay in the queue and be retried with exponential backoff. The local data remains intact.
